comments:
Hoping this can be looked at in 3.3:

I'm not sure why or how, but I sometimes I run into a problem when creating a 
new artifact. I get an IWAT message on the screen saying it was unable to 
create the artifact, and I see this error in the log. Something about the 
classpath of the project... I looked at this method and it does do some null 
checking, however there is the getRawClasspath() which is never null-checked 
and so might be the problem.

This only happens for some people, in a certain higher product (I couldn't 
reproduce it on my machine). But when it does happen, it's quite severe (you 
can't create URL tests, etc because you need artifacts, but can't create them.

Scott -- I can have Bianca look at this if you'd rather.  But since you've been
concentrating on the execution area while Bianca has been concentrating on UI, I
figured you could have a quick look first.

I have spent some time trying to reproduce this problem and have been unable 
so far.  Please provide or try to find a reproducible test case, if not I will 
still continue to try to track this down and fix this for the 3.3 release.

Curtis, please try to get a reproducible case from the users that have seen 
this problem.  I keep trying and cannot reproduce this one -- next time it is 
seen please have the users save their project off and attach it to this defect 
or provide exact conditions that would allow me to debug this better.  I tried 
cases where the projects were the wrong type and cases where the classpath was 
empty, etc, some boundary conditions and could not reproduce--thanks.

Have not seen this since, so I'm closing it. I suspect this was caused by a 
problem in the distribution of the higher product - there was a known problem 
where some plugins had both 3.0.1 and 3.0.2 versions installed. Since this was 
fixed, the problem has not been seen. Closing this bug.
